Comment: Funny how authoritarian regimes are all alike.  Mao's police state dictatorship featured a Cultural Revolution whose principle victims were intellectuals.   Hitler's Third Reich kept lists of intellectuals who were to be rounded up and executed as soon each new country was conquered.   Like Mao and Hitler, Trump sees anyone with a brain as an existential threat to his authoritarian tyranny.
Author: Beantown-Jack

Comment: And the Khmer Rouge not only forced educated professionals to leave the cities for an agrarian existence in the country, but targeted people with glasses and suchlike based on their banal notions of anti-intellectualism and who might oppose their dictates.    Good the Vietnamese Army came by to stop them eventually, as who knows how far Pol Pot could have gotten if not for that intervention?  As the U.S. sure didn’t seem interested in dealing with the blowback of their secret bombing of Cambodia during Vietnam…
Author: oliversurpless
